WorkItem.ClosedComment: CNR - if it's still a problem, please open a new defect.
WorkItem.Description:
Hey i just played my Frost DK to 80 and played around to see what upgrades i can get from heroics and triumph emblems. Then i just noticed something:
I have 3 Trinkets: twice a switf hand of justice (64haste) and one is a caster trinket with another 74 haste (and 1k shadowdamage on casts (so proccs sometimes from howl/icy touch)
 
now if i equip twice hand of justice, i get ~30 dps on each
if i equip the caster trinket this and many other haste equip (like neck) show negative values (-20 on the pendalum and -25 on the swift hand of justice for example)
so rwar even suggest the stamina trinket (azjolnerub 2nd boss) provides "more" dps... this cant be.
 
same goes if i add a 10 haste stone to a socket (in golves)... i virtually lose damage against an unsocket one  (even i have 14 strength and 10 haste more!)
WorkItem.Summary: [DPSDK] Haste Threshold starts Haste Negative DPS Values

Comments.Message: i narrowed the problem down to the passive haste of icy talons, without that talent (but buff active or not) the haste seem to scale normal, no matter how i itemize. but with the talent haste goes from negative to huge positve amounts...

maybe that wasnt it, the problem seems more overall, haste gets very jumpy from negative to huge postive amounts even with talent/buff from icy talon on/off in different combinations, depend on the amount of haste i already got.

its now nearly impossible to determine haste items for frost dk... maybe the main problem is killing machine, as with more swings it maybe calculates a proc less, so the overall damage breaks down? i have no idea :/ i hope this get fixed till patch as i saw we get even more haste (and maybe some more dks consider rolling frost and need rawr ^^)
Haste had similar jumpiness problems in the Lock module, until the new dev recently scrapped the whole model and started from scratch. Maybe consult with him on the subject?
Not sure if this is still an issue, but I'll look into the haste scaling as noted here if it's still a problem w/ b19
